Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves

Class Pose

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves.Pose
All Implemented Interfaces:
FuturePose
public final class Pose extends Object implements FuturePose
Represents a pose in 2D space, consisting of an \`x\` and \`y\` position and a heading (orientation). The pose can be associated with a specific coordinate system. DO NOT USE THIS UNLESS YOU ARE DOING CURVE RELATED THINGS!!! USE RAYMOND's Pose2d INSTEAD!!!

Provides methods for pose arithmetic, coordinate system conversion, and utility functions such as distance calculation and conversion between polar and cartesian coordinates.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Pose()
    Constructs a pose at the origin (0, 0) with heading 0, using the default Pedro coordinate system.
    Pose(double x, double y)
    Constructs a pose with the specified position and a heading of 0, using the default Pedro coordinate system.
    Pose(double x, double y, double heading)
    Constructs a pose with the specified position and heading, using the default Pedro coordinate system.
    Pose(double x, double y, double heading, CoordinateSystem coordinateSystem)
    Constructs a pose with the specified position, heading, and coordinate system.
    Pose(Pose2d pose)

    • times

      public Pose times(double scalar)
      Multiplies the pose by a scalar. This scales x, y, and heading by the scalar value, but does not change the coordinate system.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar value
      Returns:
      the resulting pose

    • scale

      public Pose scale(double scalar)
      This scales the current Pose by a given scale factor. The heading or coordinate system is not affected.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scale factor
      Returns:
      returns the scaled Pose

      This returns a Pose that is the linear combination of the current pose and another pose.

      scaleThis - the coefficient for the current pose
      scaleOther - the second coefficient for the other pose

      the resulting pose

      accuracy - the allowed difference
      Returns:
      true if poses are approximately equal, false otherwise

      public Pose rotate(double theta, boolean rotateHeading)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the rotated Pose.

    • mirror

      public Pose mirror()
      This mirrors this pose across the field (default of 141.5 inches in length + width) in Pedro coordinates. This will return a new Pose in Pedro coordinates.
      Returns:
      the mirrored Pose.

    • mirror

      public Pose mirror(double fieldLength)
      This mirrors this pose across the field in Pedro coordinates. This will return a new Pose in Pedro coordinates.
      Parameters:
      fieldLength - Distance from one end of the field to the other along the x-axis.
      Returns:
      the mirrored Pose.

    • cartesianToPolar

      public static double[] cartesianToPolar(double x, double y)
      Converts cartesian coordinates to polar coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate
      y - the y-coordinate
      Returns:
      an array \`[r, theta]\` where r is the radius and theta is the angle in radians
